channel.title: Nexuiz
channel.description:
Don't know if anyone knows about it; Nexuiz is a free cross-platform online fps running on a highly modified Quake 3 Engine, the DarkPlaces engine. Not the best looking game of all time, but if you want to get away from CSS, TF2 or MW2 for a while, i would recommend it.
Requirements:
400 MB of hard drive space Windows 2000/XP/Vista (32-bit or 64-bit) Mac OS X 10.4 or better (PPC or x86) Linux Kernel 2.2 or better with glibc High Quality/Recommended - A 1.5 Ghz Intel Pentium 4 chip or AMD Athlon 1500+ or better - 9600ati or 5700fx or better - 512 MB of ram or better Low Quality - 1 Ghz Pentium III or AMD Athlon - Geforce2 Video card - 512 MB of ram
The game can be downloaded [url]https://alientrap.org/nexuiz/[/url]
Have fun!

it’s like Quake 3 arena/team arena if’y ask me.

item.title: Nexuiz
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Nexuiz is actually a lot of fun. I hear the team got acquired by another dev house and the name was licenced. They’re making a paid version of the game, and some of the team will develop the original free FPS further under a different name.

item.title: Nexuiz
item.dc:creator: lambda
item.description:
Don’t know if anyone knows about it; Nexuiz is a free cross-platform online fps running on a highly modified Quake 3 Engine, the DarkPlaces engine.
Not the best looking game of all time, but if you want to get away from CSS, TF2 or MW2 for a while, i would recommend it.

Requirements:

400 MB of hard drive space
Windows 2000/XP/Vista (32-bit or 64-bit)
Mac OS X 10.4 or better (PPC or x86)
Linux Kernel 2.2 or better with glibc
High Quality/Recommended

  • A 1.5 Ghz Intel Pentium 4 chip or AMD Athlon 1500+ or better
  • 9600ati or 5700fx or better
  • 512 MB of ram or better
    Low Quality
  • 1 Ghz Pentium III or AMD Athlon
  • Geforce2 Video card
  • 512 MB of ram

The game can be downloaded https://alientrap.org/nexuiz/

Have fun!

Read full topic
